name: Hotel Excelsior

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a clean two-star hotel given the lack of AC and the small size of the rooms and tiny TV. There is only one English-speaking channel (BBC world) anyway!
reviews.title: Excellent breakfast/free internet; Small rooms with no AC and tiny TV

likes.liked: — the breakfast and free internet in the business center
likes.disliked: — No AC and tiny room with Tiny TV

reviews.text: I would NOT stay here in the summer. You will not be able to sleep because it will be too hot and opening the windows means major noise from the grand central station. But it is a good stay for a night or two or anytime it is cold if you want to save money. We had only a one night stay in frankfurt (plenty to see all the good places in frankfurt if you ask me!) and for 69 Euros for two people in April, it was well worth it, especially with the nice breakfast and FREE internet access in the business center, not to mention the location and the easy access to the airport with one train ride of 15 minute duration with S8 or S9.
reviews.title: Great central location, good value for money

reviews.text: The Excelsior is right next to the Central train station in Frankfurt, and has tram, underground, trains, buses and a taxi rank on it's doorstep. A fantastic base for travel, you can also walk into town in 10-15 minutes.
reviews.title: enjoyed the location

reviews.text: The staff were nice and friendly, and the rooms and bathrooms were fine although the decor is a little tired.
reviews.title: Right across from the Hauptbahnof

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a free minibar in each room which is great, and there's also tea, coffee, cake and fruit available in the lobby all day. I didn't have a chance to sample breakfast, but it does go on until 11 which is nice.
reviews.title: Good Price and Location

reviews.text: Excellent value for your money. I booked the hotel by calling direct. It was very easy to find as it is just across the street from the main train station. I came in approx 1 hr early and they let me check in. The elevator is a little small and slow. The room was a bit tiny. But, the place was clean and provided great service. Free minibar and excellent morning buffet. It is walking distance to a lot of sites in Frankfurt. I am going to book again when I swing by Frankfurt in a few months.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

likes.liked: — Location, free minibar and great breakfast

reviews.title: A curate's egg
reviews.text: Upside: Great location, very nice staff, clean, no outside noise at my room at the rear.

Downside: Paper-thin internal wall to my room - I could hear everything the guy in the next room did. Happily he was a considerate sort who retired early & didn't get up before me, so once I had my earplugs in, I didn't hear him & slept really well.
reviews.title: Good budget value near train station

likes.disliked: — Parking garage was a bit tight for parking larger cars.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I'd probably go back because judging from the reviews, most of the rooms don't seem to have this problem.
reviews.title: Excellent Value!

reviews.text: One thing I search for when booking hotels & would pay a premium for is free wi-fi in the rooms. This hotel lacks it. There's one wired access cable in the lobby, & there's a business centre, however.
reviews.title: No Complaints from us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was okay. Did not get an opportunity to try the breakfast buffet as we had an early flight. The beds were comfortable. There was no air conditioning but a fan is supplied. There is a free mini bar. You are directly across from the South end of the train station so very convienent. The room overall was clean. The thing I did not like is that there was no water at all in the room for the first hour we were there but were not advised of this at checkin. The wake up service does not work on the self programmable phone. And if you call the front desk you more then likely will not get the wake up call so be sure you have a travel alarm.
reviews.title: Good for a short stay

reviews.text: Stayed for one night. Great location close to the main station. Paid just 53 euro for a single room. Superb staff with very generous service. The minibar in the room is all free which is very nice. Free Internet downstairs or wireless in room. Free tea, coffee, fruit & cake all day downstairs. You can phone from the rooms for free (true!!) all over the world!!
reviews.title: Great Great Hotel close to main Station!!

likes.liked: — Location, breakfast and all that's free

reviews.title: great stay, good value.
reviews.text: i was staying alone in frankfurt for 3 nights, so was of course very nervous where i was going to stay. After tons of online searching, i decided on this place, since it was close to the train station, and it was a great deal...Well out of all other hotels i stayed in in Europe, this had the best breakfast and a free internet lounge with about 5 computers or so to use for free. i really liked that.after not checking email for awhile, it was nice to have free access whenever i wanted. the location was so conveinent.When i had to go to the airport in the morning, i just walked across the street to catch a train.It is not a far walk from the Zeil, and the Romer. i enjoyed walking around Frankfurt all day, then going back to my room at night,

reviews.title: Great value for money!
reviews.text: maybe not the safest area to walk in at night, since of course it is close to the train station.
room was SMALL, but clean, basic, and good enough for sleeping, etc......
reviews.title: Not good - 2 star feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CHECK-IN DATE: 17 May 2008
reviews.title: Phenomenal value for money!

reviews.text: CHECK-OUT DATE: 18 May 2008
reviews.title: Hotel Excelsior: Simple good value

reviews.title: great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: 1 Double (B&B) Daily total
reviews.title: Old, shabby, not recommended

likes.liked: — free mini bar, close to train station

description: Located right on Venice Lido beach, the Hotel Excelsior is a masterpiece of Venetian architecture dating back to the early 1900. An exclusive 5 star Deluxe Resort, of Moorish style and recalling a fabulous Venetian Renaissance palace, the Hotel Excelsior is ideal for family holidays, romantic getaways, conferences or special events in Venice.Stunning halls overlooking the sea, highly creative, contemporary Italian cuisine and competent, skilled staff, become ingredients of the hotel’s recognition and awareness among the best wedding and special events locations. Welcome to the Hotel Excelsior, for more than one century the best match of luxury, history, tradition with comfort and service, carefully built around you.
